Articles.Content:
Finally, I did it! I made SCRAMjet Engine, which will bring your space plane to the upper atmosphere. Ignite it at the altitude about 15km and go ascent!

I worked on this project in 0.15, but it didn\'t work. But X-7/9 gave me idea that it can work, and I changed model and options.

Start work at the 15-20km and ignite your LFEs at 40-45km. Speed at the 40km altitude is about 2000 m/s.

Options is fully mine, so I hope that none of you will say that I stole the settings from X - 7/9.

Screenshots:

Download:

http://www./?xcae73i78b50lai

Yes, but there are a lot of ways how to get stability.

1. Attach it under the COG.

2. Fuel balance.

3. Attach this engines in pairs - one above, one below.
What I mean is, does it consume fuel realistcally or is it 'overpowered'?
Hm... I can\'t say realistic is it or no, but it has 150 thrust and 0.7 consumption. I can\'t say that it\'s overpowered.
This looks great and Ill have to dl it and try it now. Good job and im glad I could inspire you as you did me ;D
This engine should have fuel consumption like a jet engine, maybe little more in the atmosphere, and like rocket engine in the space.
SCRAMjet don\'t work in space. It works on the high altitudes, but in atmosphere.

SCRAMjet don\'t work in space. It works on the high altitudes, but in atmosphere.

Oh sorry, but idea was the same: the higher in the atmosphere it gets - more fuel it should use)
The higher atmosphere it gets - fewer efficiency it has. Lower thrust but the same consumption.
